summary: The 'Make the District of Columbia Safe and Beautiful Act' aims to beautify Washington D.C. by establishing a program under the Secretary of the Interior to coordinate cleanliness efforts and restore monuments. It also establishes the District of Columbia Safe and Beautiful Commission, comprised of various federal entities, to address issues like immigration law enforcement, forensic lab accreditation, police support, concealed carry licensing, pretrial detention policies, and fare evasion. The Commission will report to Congress and both the program and the commission will sunset on January 2, 2029.
